00033 #include <stdint.h>
00034 #include "em_device.h"

00036 /*******************************************************************************
00037  ******************************   DEFINES   ************************************
00038  ******************************************************************************/
00039 
00041 #define EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ  (32768UL)
00042 #define EFM32_ULFRCO_FREQ (1000UL)
00043 
00044 /*******************************************************************************
00045  **************************   LOCAL VARIABLES   ********************************
00046  ******************************************************************************/
00047 
00048 /* System oscillator frequencies. These frequencies are normally constant */
00049 /* for a target, but they are made configurable in order to allow run-time */
00050 /* handling of different boards. The crystal oscillator clocks can be set */
00051 /* compile time to a non-default value by defining respective EFM32_nFXO_FREQ */
00052 /* values according to board design. By defining the EFM32_nFXO_FREQ to 0, */
00053 /* one indicates that the oscillator is not present, in order to save some */
00054 /* SW footprint. */
00055 
00056 #ifndef EFM32_HFXO_FREQ
00057 #define EFM32_HFXO_FREQ (24000000UL)
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #define EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ (21000000UL)
00061 
00062 /* Do not define variable if HF crystal oscillator not present */
00063 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00064 
00066 static uint32_t SystemHFXOClock = EFM32_HFXO_FREQ;
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 #ifndef EFM32_LFXO_FREQ
00071 #define EFM32_LFXO_FREQ (EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ)
00072 #endif
00073 
00074 /* Do not define variable if LF crystal oscillator not present */
00075 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00076 
00078 static uint32_t SystemLFXOClock = EFM32_LFXO_FREQ;
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 /*******************************************************************************
00083  **************************   GLOBAL VARIABLES   *******************************
00084  ******************************************************************************/
00085 
00093 uint32_t SystemCoreClock;
00094 
00095 /*******************************************************************************
00096  **************************   GLOBAL FUNCTIONS   *******************************
00097  ******************************************************************************/
00098 
00099 /***************************************************************************/
00116 uint32_t SystemCoreClockGet(void)
00117 {
00118   uint32_t ret;
00119 
00120   ret = SystemHFClockGet();
00121   ret >>= (CMU->HFCORECLKDIV & _CMU_HFCORECLKDIV_HFCORECLKDIV_MASK) >>
00122           _CMU_HFCORECLKDIV_HFCORECLKDIV_SHIFT;
00123 
00124   /* Keep CMSIS variable up-to-date just in case */
00125   SystemCoreClock = ret;
00126 
00127   return ret;
00128 }
00129 
00130 
00131 /***************************************************************************/
00141 uint32_t SystemMaxCoreClockGet(void)
00142 {
00143   return (EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ > EFM32_HFXO_FREQ ? \
00144           EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ : EFM32_HFXO_FREQ);
00145 }
00146 
00147 
00148 /***************************************************************************/
00158 uint32_t SystemHFClockGet(void)
00159 {
00160   uint32_t ret;
00161 
00162   switch (CMU->STATUS & (CMU_STATUS_HFRCOSEL | CMU_STATUS_HFXOSEL
00163                          | CMU_STATUS_LFRCOSEL | CMU_STATUS_LFXOSEL
00164 #if defined(CMU_STATUS_USHFRCODIV2SEL)
00165                          | CMU_STATUS_USHFRCODIV2SEL
00166 #endif
00167                         ))
00168   {
00169     case CMU_STATUS_LFXOSEL:
00170 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00171       ret = SystemLFXOClock;
00172 #else
00173       /* We should not get here, since core should not be clocked. May */
00174       /* be caused by a misconfiguration though. */
00175       ret = 0;
00176 #endif
00177       break;
00178 
00179     case CMU_STATUS_LFRCOSEL:
00180       ret = EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ;
00181       break;
00182 
00183     case CMU_STATUS_HFXOSEL:
00184 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00185       ret = SystemHFXOClock;
00186 #else
00187       /* We should not get here, since core should not be clocked. May */
00188       /* be caused by a misconfiguration though. */
00189       ret = 0;
00190 #endif
00191       break;
00192 
00193 #if defined(CMU_STATUS_USHFRCODIV2SEL)
00194     case CMU_STATUS_USHFRCODIV2SEL:
00195       ret = 24000000;
00196       break;
00197 #endif
00198 
00199     default: /* CMU_STATUS_HFRCOSEL */
00200       switch (CMU->HFRCOCTRL & _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_MASK)
00201       {
00202       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_21MHZ:
00203         ret = 21000000;
00204         break;
00205 
00206       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_14MHZ:
00207         ret = 14000000;
00208         break;
00209 
00210       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_11MHZ:
00211         ret = 11000000;
00212         break;
00213 
00214       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_7MHZ:
00215         ret = 6600000;
00216         break;
00217 
00218       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_1MHZ:
00219         ret = 1200000;
00220         break;
00221 
00222       default:
00223         ret = 0;
00224         break;
00225       }
00226       break;
00227   }
00228 
00229   return ret;
00230 }
00231 
00232 
00233 /**************************************************************************/
00243 uint32_t SystemHFXOClockGet(void)
00244 {
00245   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00246 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00247   return SystemHFXOClock;
00248 #else
00249   return 0;
00250 #endif
00251 }
00252 
00253 
00254 /**************************************************************************/
00269 void SystemHFXOClockSet(uint32_t freq)
00270 {
00271   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00272 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00273   SystemHFXOClock = freq;
00274 
00275   /* Update core clock frequency if HFXO is used to clock core */
00276   if (CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_HFXOSEL)
00277   {
00278     /* The function will update the global variable */
00279     SystemCoreClockGet();
00280   }
00281 #else
00282   (void)freq; /* Unused parameter */
00283 #endif
00284 }

00287 /**************************************************************************/
00299 void SystemInit(void)
00300 {
00301 }
00302 
00303 
00304 /**************************************************************************/
00314 uint32_t SystemLFRCOClockGet(void)
00315 {
00316   /* Currently we assume that this frequency is properly tuned during */
00317   /* manufacturing and is not changed after reset. If future requirements */
00318   /* for re-tuning by user, we can add support for that. */
00319   return EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ;
00320 }
00321 
00322 
00323 /**************************************************************************/
00333 uint32_t SystemULFRCOClockGet(void)
00334 {
00335   /* The ULFRCO frequency is not tuned, and can be very inaccurate */
00336   return EFM32_ULFRCO_FREQ;
00337 }
00338 
00339 
00340 /**************************************************************************/
00350 uint32_t SystemLFXOClockGet(void)
00351 {
00352   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00353 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00354   return SystemLFXOClock;
00355 #else
00356   return 0;
00357 #endif
00358 }
00359 
00360 
00361 /**************************************************************************/
00376 void SystemLFXOClockSet(uint32_t freq)
00377 {
00378   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00379 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00380   SystemLFXOClock = freq;
00381 
00382   /* Update core clock frequency if LFXO is used to clock core */
00383   if (CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFXOSEL)
00384   {
00385     /* The function will update the global variable */
00386     SystemCoreClockGet();
00387   }
00388 #else
00389   (void)freq; /* Unused parameter */
00390 #endif
00391 }
